basics.name: Christian Henning
basics.label: Machine Learning Researcher & R&D Lead
basics.summary: AI expert with a PhD from ETH Zurich, specializing in computer vision, uncertainty and lifelong learning. Currently leading R&D at EthonAI.

work.name: EthonAI
work.summary: Spearheading EthonAI’s internal research and development initiatives to advance applied AI in industrial settings.

work.name: EthonAI
work.summary: Led the development of an AI-powered product for industrial anomaly detection, balancing software engineering, algorithmic innovation, and cross-functional leadership.
highlights: Defined and owned product roadmap in close collaboration with end-users
Managed team and coordinated engineering, research, and QA efforts
Actively contributed to hiring and onboarding across the organization

work.name: EthonAI
work.summary: Joined as one of the first employees at EthonAI, playing a pivotal role in the initial development of its computer vision product stack.
highlights: Worked across backend, frontend, ML model development, DevOps, and QA
Built and deployed early prototypes used in pilot deployments
Collaborated closely with customers to shape feature development and UX

work.name: ETH Zurich
work.summary: PhD in machine learning and computational neuroscience, working in an interdisciplinary environment.
highlights: Focus on continual learning and Bayesian neural networks
Published at conferences such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML.

education.summary: Thesis: 'Knowledge uncertainty and lifelong learning in neural systems'.
Focus on Human-Computer-Interaction, Systems-Engineering and Theoretical Computer Science.

awards.title: GFFT Förderpreis 2018 – Best Master's thesis
awards.summary: The GFFT society aims to improve the innovation transfer from research to industry in Germany.

awards.title: Best Multimodal Paper Award – ICMR 2017
awards.summary: The award was dedicated to my first publication, summarizing the outcome of my Master thesis.

awards.title: Studienstiftung des deutschen Volkes
awards.awarder: Scholarship from the German National Academic Foundation.

awards.title: Preis des Präsidiums
awards.awarder: Received for outstanding achievements within my faculty.

awards.title: Deutschlandstipendium
awards.awarder: Scholarship from the National Scholarship Program.

volunteer.summary: Supported refugees through asylum and job search processes.
Organized orientation events and student activities.
